website_summaries.verdict: It has some nice features that others don't offer, but the small fit won't work for everyone.
pros: Comfortable thanks to the dual-layer design w/soft interior and firm outer layer
cons: You only get one for the price, and the instructions aren't very clear

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. It’s a fine temporary night guard. Doesn’t make my teeth hurt in the morning, and I barely feel it at night. My mother who is a Dental Hygenist picked it out for me so I can use while I wait to get my professional one made. I only gave it 4 stars because the directions on how to mold it to your teeth were NOT correct and didn’t work. You actually have to boil it IN the water for a short amount of time, rather than set it in hot water. Trust me on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hamster Girl

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I have a small mouth and this thing still didn't fit (my back molars aren't even covered which is my trouble area and whole reason I purchased this guard) but it didn't even hold its form after the first night. The instructions say that the mold should stay on your teeth. It did the first night. The second night my teeth barely fit in the mold, like it shrank, and wouldn't stay on my teeth at all. Complete waste of money I can't use it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Too big- buy oral B brand instead
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend purchased this and after the first night he threw it out. After molding it to his teeth it was like wearing a sports mouth guard- too big and uncomfortable to sleep in. He couldn’t even close his mouth and it hurt his jaw more than before wearing one. He bought an oral b brand one that he loves- much smaller design and works really well for him
customer_reviews.author: Fdesorte

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to get a "locked in" fit. I've tried over and over following the directions to a T, but it is not working for me. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Just what the dentist ordered... at a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.text: My dentist informed me I ground my teeth at night and needed a night guard. Yeah I almost fell out of his chair Winnie informed me a custom fit guard would cost $600. My girlfriend's sister-in-law's a dentist, and she charges $400. I thought there has to be a cheaper alternative and found this one. The molding process was simple and quick, I did have to trim a little of the rear portion of the Guard with scissors, but I've been sleeping with it for a couple months, and it seems to work fine. No weird taste, snaps in place and stays there, I've never choked on it, and it comes with a nice little storage case.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Rock 9

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for my tiny mouth
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small mouth and jaw. I followed directions to mold this to my mouth however, it was still loose and fit awkwardly around my lips and cheeks to the point I couldn't close my lips comfortably. This isn't the company's fault. The over the counter mouth gaurds just dont work for some people. Yet, I implore you to try it before spending the crazy amount with the night gaurd your dentist recommends (that your insurance likely won't cover). This just might work for you, unless you have a small mouth like me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never Molded
customer_reviews.text: I tried to mold this to my teeth multiple times, the sticky parts that you are supposed to push sideways into your teeth would just fall back into being flat - thus never creating a good suction on my teeth and falling off when opening mouth. Also - the front that you bite down is very long (towards your lips) and did not feel at all like it would be comfortable when sleeping. The SISU SOVA is much more minimalist and comfortable - which is what I am going to go with. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Ian G.

customer_reviews.title: all but the back two teeth on each side
customer_reviews.text: Always thought about getting a mouth guard, and I saw this amongst others and the price point was unbeatable especially w prime shipping, watching instructional videos is totally different from doing it yourself but after a couple reheating and remolding I found a good fit, only downside is I wish they made a larger size but alas they don’t so my back two molars remain uncovered but I can’t say that it grinds necessarily.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Too large. Made me want to gag.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Placker's Grind-No-More for a couple of years to protect my teeth from nighttime grinding. However, it wasn't helping with my clenching so I still regularly was waking up with jaw and neck pain. My dentist suggested this brand to keep my teeth in place better overnight. I did boil it and fit it to my mouth; however, every time I tried to sleep with it, it made me feel like I was going to throw up. It's just huge. I gave up and went back to using the Grind-No-More. I did however really like the little case that comes with this so I do use that still.
customer_reviews.author: M. M Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great product for those who grind their teeth
customer_reviews.text: This is a great night guard for people who grind their teeth at night. It has a good cushioning substance which helps to prevent a sore jaw when you wake up in the morning. It is also thick enough to protect your teeth from wearing down. It is nice because it is sturdy and will not wear out quickly. They are easy to customize with either using a microwave or stove top. I cannot sleep without one of these and highly recommend it for anyone who grinds their teeth. This is great protection!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy this if you care about your oral health!!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, falls apart, terrible. As someone whom has suffered from broxism my entire life, I have tried just about every night guess from $15-$500+ and I can tell you this one is garbage. Cheap, falls apart, does not protect and does not have enough support. It will also cause your gums to receide do your self and your oral health a favor and DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. It will only make it worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jean G.

customer_reviews.title: I just couldn't get used to this...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this mouth / teeth guard. However after shaping it in hot water it just was still too big and uncomfortable for me to sleep. Because the rubber compresses when you form it, it "squishes" out from the harder plastic/rubber part and really makes me feel like I'm going to gag. I tried trimming the excess off but it still bothered me. I was trying to make it work, but overall I think there needs to be a better option. I question all of the super positive reviews on this one - unless I'm just a weird exception and it works well for everyone else! :(
customer_reviews.author: T is for Tech

customer_reviews.title: Dentist Results at Hundreds Less
customer_reviews.text: I once had a bite guard from a dentist and it worked well but cost hundreds of dollars. I had one from the grocery store and it kept my teeth from grinding but it didn't keep me from biting my tongue and didn't stay in very well. This one stays in, keeps my teeth apart, and doesn't interfere with my sleep. I was sceptical that it would fit but I followed the directions and it worked on the first attempt.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pearson

customer_reviews.title: not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was a dental assistant for 14 years. I know how to follow the instructions and make the mouth guard. It was too bulky and large for my mouth. I kept gagging on it.. I trimmed it down and it still was too large. I would not recommend this product. There must be a better design for this product.
customer_reviews.author: deena defrain

customer_reviews.title: Better than a dentist-made night guard!
customer_reviews.text: Been buying this product every 8 months for the last 2 years! The price on Amazon is less expensive than buying at other retailers. I have tried another brand and had difficulty getting a good fit. This one may take a few tries to get a good fit but it's worth the effort! Comfortable and snug fit all night. It does start to yellow over time but I use Polident and Listerine to make sure it is properly sanitized. Will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette F.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome mouth guard! I thought i had a small mouth but it actually fit me perfectly! I followed the directions and everything is going just the way it was supposed to. I've had it for a couple weeks now and already put some dents in it. I got it because i grind my teeth at night pretty badly. This works very well and is mostly comfortable. I can't seem to keep my mouth closed when sleeping with it though. I don't find it a problem but some people might.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine G.

customer_reviews.title: Used mouth guard shipped to customer
customer_reviews.text: The is a auto subscription for the doctor's night guard that I received the end of June and just open. Apparently this item was return as you can see the box has some damage to it and the guard case is dirty, look at the inside of the box is also dirty. That's not all, there's no mouth guard in the case and I'm out of $17.00 and it to last to return. Very disappointed because amazon allow this used defective missing pieces to be shipped to another customer. I am canceling my auto subscription, I send alot of money buying product from Amazon very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Jones

customer_reviews.title: The guard acts like a hinge holding in the back and falling forward ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd I have purchased in two weeks. The first one I thought I may have not properly followed directions as it falls loose in my mouth and becomes a choking hazard. The problem is there is no material in the front of the your incisors to mold into place. The guard acts like a hinge holding in the back and falling forward into your mouth. I purchased this 2nd one attempting to keep the guard far forward to attempt to get more material in front of my teeth with no results. Same problem where the guard falls into mouth. This is a waste of your money. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Larry, Texas

customer_reviews.title: Not using
customer_reviews.text: I’m unable to use this guard because it’s too bulky and hard. I’m unable to keep my mouth closed around it at night in order to use my sleep apnea machine. It’s very thick and hard and also hurts my teeth and gums.
customer_reviews.author: Buttercup

customer_reviews.title: Good night mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses these mouth guards to help keep her from grinding her teeth at night. You can customize the guard to your teeth so the fit is righrt every time. Instructions are easy to follow and the guard works to help with night time teeth grinding. Very pleased with this product. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: EA Poe

customer_reviews.title: Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: I tried a nighguard once before and it didn't work for me. I've used this one for the past 3 nights and so far, I find it very comfortable. It is smaller than I expected and much smaller than the one I had before. For me, that's good, because my mouth is a little on the smaller side.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Good mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: This is the best, cheapest night guard that I have found so far. It is bulky and can get frustrating to get used to. Otherwise, I like it and found it could fit better after re-sizing it. I wish I could cut off the extra on the sides. I believe I made a small indent from grinding my teeth, but it seems very durable and have not has other issues. It seems like a durable rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions precisely for molding this to my mouth, and still found it impossible to sleep in it. I'm 5'10", so it's not because of being small like some of the other reviewers. It feels bulky and intrusive. Honestly, I found the Plackers Grind No More dental night protector to work far better, far more comfortably. And I've been using a single box of them for over 2 years, just about to finally order a 2nd box now.
customer_reviews.author: Bart L

customer_reviews.title: Works just as intended and is cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap and work well. (Don't wake up with a headache, and they last long). I've tried other mouth guards with varying degrees of success. One thing to note is that the lower hard portion does stick out a bit and SOMETIMES will irritate my lips, but that's almost always if I have a canker sore or previously but my lip. Overall, I like these and will continue to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Spending Over $700 For the Custom One From the Dentist
customer_reviews.text: The price is right. The product seems to function fine. Sometimes I end up spitting it out at night, but that would likely happen even with a more custom one. Worth a try if you need a nightguard and your dental insurance doesn't cover the cost of the ones made by your dentist.
customer_reviews.author: J&J Andreason

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s weird but I wake up and my teeth almost feel like they don’t align properly or as normal. My top back teeth hurt more when I use it. Between grinding and wisdom teeth coming in this product is useless and causes more pain. Don’t buy and you can’t return it.
customer_reviews.author: A Helms

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to follow the instructions. Unfortunately its garbage. Was pretty much a chewing toy. Only got it because I had to evacuate my building after a bus crash and had no nightguard for weeks... Lasted 48 hrs
customer_reviews.author: Yen

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you don't want a bulky item in your mouth.
customer_reviews.text: Way too big to be comfortable to sleep in! Feels like I'm choking and gagging when its in even before sleeping. Definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Coons

customer_reviews.title: This product is total CRAP.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it one star because zero stars is not an option. Even at $11, it’s grossly overpriced, in fact I wouldn’t give 2 cents for it. Followed the directions, using a timer every step of the way. It molds to your teeth, to an extent, but easily falls off. I will bring this up with my dentist, who recommended it, to be sure she stops suggesting this to other patients.
customer_reviews.author: ANA

customer_reviews.title: Not for Everyone
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for this were super clear and easy to go through with. My main issue, though, was the thickness. Though I can appreciate why you would want a guard so thick, for nighttime, I, like many other reviews I’ve read, had trouble keeping the guard in my mouth as it was wayyy too thick to be comfortable. My jaw started to hurt with it in my mouth. Though my mouth is fairly small (only fairly), I would think it would be difficult for a lot of people to find comfort in using this.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Kimbro

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This guard is useless and I ended up throwing it away after 4 attempts to get it to fit correctly. I followed the instructions, but it kept falling out of my mouth. Also, it made me gag. Waste of money and very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: S Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Falls out easily
customer_reviews.text: It does not mold properly and it falls out of the mouth, instructions were followed properly and there were multiple attempts. My partner had better luck with hers by molding her front teeth further back even though the instructions say otherwise. Do yourself a favor and get a proper mouthguard.
customer_reviews.author: Somber

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I was told I would have to go to specialist and spend $700 (w/ insurance) on the device alone. Works great- just follow the directions closely. My receding gums lines have stopped further recession after starting use of this product. It's a little large and hard to get used to, but better than spending $700 plus office visit fees.
customer_reviews.author: dianelangston

customer_reviews.title: Good material and fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits very comfortably throughout the night. Does not ride on the gums. I've used it every night for a month now and the material is still holding strong. Cleans very well with a denture cleaner (store brands I found are cheaper than online). Would buy again if I hadn't just found a deal at my local liquidators.
customer_reviews.author: A. Supleme

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job
customer_reviews.text: I really really struggled molding this. I have used several over the years, but this one is extra thick so when I used it, didn’t feel like it gripped at all. I had to do it about 4 times. I do like it now that I got it to a fit I like. I’ve had it several months and still no hole through. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the money. I grind my teeth really bad and couldn't afford $700 for a custom made bite guard. They last 6 months, don't make my jaw ache, don't hurt my gums, and my teeth get no wear. They are a little bulky, but not bad if you shape them well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Functional and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I am a habitual teeth grinder to the point where I have cracked two porcelain caps. I go through about 1 of these every two months which, for the price point, is still cheaper than a custom made one from the dentist. Plus, if I lose one (which strangely happens quite a bit), I'm not worried about it. They do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gale

customer_reviews.title: I bought this after my dentist told me it looked like I gind my teeth in my sleep
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my dentist told me it looked like I gind my teeth in my sleep. I followed the instructions on molding it to my teeth but it would not stay in place after heating it up several times and tryinng to get it to conform to my teeth. In addition, it was way to bulky to leave in your mouth and try and sleep. I tried to cut some off the ends as the instructions suggest but it was still uncomfortable. I wound up throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: then molding to my bottom teeth and found this WAY more comfortable than this mouth guard
customer_reviews.text: am i the only person who feels that night guards should mold to the bottom row? then gravity doesn't pull them off your teeth and they still fit between the molars in the back and prevent grinding. ...I ended up buying the 99 cent mouthguard at walmart, cutting them small, then molding to my bottom teeth and found this WAY more comfortable than this mouth guard. I found the hard plastic portion too thick to be comfortable, but that may just be my preference...who knows.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Stiff, poor fit, would not stay in
customer_reviews.text: Stiff and overlarge; poor fit despite heating and molding per instructions; would not stay in my mouth for more than a few minutes. Overall a poor fit and one wonders why my dentist recommended it! It sits unused.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Guards against my nighttime clenching
customer_reviews.text: This is great and was 1/10th of the price of a custom mouth guard. I’ve been using it for a year and it still hasn’t worn out. I was with soap and water to eliminate odors.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Custom fit!!
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy to mold!! Perfect fit and it doesn’t break the Bank. I grind my teeth something awful. I’ve recently started having expensive and extensive dental work done. So buying one every several months to make sure I’m not doing any damage at night truely make me feel so much better. Very comfortable to use!!
customer_reviews.author: Suziq2much

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mold
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help with my teeth grinding it was easy very easy to mold. I used it the first night and my teeth are sore now. It's probably just because I'm not used to this item yet though. For the price you cant beat it though.
customer_reviews.author: mindy

customer_reviews.title: it's a bit big, but I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This nightguard is kind of big, it might be off putting to some. of the 3 i've purchased, despite how big it is; it's my favorite. one of the other guards i purchased was knight guard, it was a hard plastic, fairly compact unit. it did fit nicely but degraded quickly. but at $15 bucks, its worth a shot. you could try trimming it, or readjusting it if it forms in a funky way the first time around. i wish they had a more petite version with the same inner layer.
customer_reviews.author: fixer818

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The mouthguard is really small I have a small mouth and it doesn’t cover my back molars. The instructions are easy to follow but it’s hard to mold the mouthguard. It’s states that if you open your mouth and the mouthguard stays in place then it’s on correctly but I’ve tried 7 times already and nothing. Also the more you boil it in order to mold it the harder it gets to mold because the mouthguard will retain some of the imprint from the past tries regardless of how long you boil it. Also it started to fall apart from the back end I guess from trying to mold to so many times..
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: this is the product you need for a bite guard!
customer_reviews.text: every time my dogs get into my last bite guard I just make a new one. I learn my lesson after losing one that cost $500 by my dentist. and quickly I’m becoming very good at making them! this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Iain Sargent

customer_reviews.title: I Don’t Think It Works
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, it doesn’t seem like a worked we just got it today, we were excited to use it but once it came to the part where you mold it, it wouldn’t stay it kept falling. My mom was biting down but it still didn’t work. We are going to try using more hot water and see what happens
customer_reviews.author: Alexa🤡💕

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a Dentek night guard similar to this one for a couple years, but I thought I’d give this one a try since it was less expensive.. Unfortunately I won’t be a repeat buyer. This is very wide and doesn’t stay on my teeth. Even though I figured it out, the directions are a little confusing. Not a terrible product, but I’ll be going back to the other night guard.
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few brands in attempt to avoid the costly dental guards. This one has worked the best. It's comfortable eventhough it's a bit bulky for my mouth it doesn't bother. I have a problem with removing the guard during the night but this one stays put for some reason. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Might cause more pain
customer_reviews.text: Horrible fit. Product not as pictured. Followed directions did not mold properly the first time. Tried again. Horrible fit. Go to the dentist and get one that fits properly. Have more pain now
customer_reviews.author: maryann

customer_reviews.title: have been using these night guards for several years. ...
customer_reviews.text: have been using these night guards for several years. each one lasts about 6 months for me. trouble is none of the local stores carry this brand anymoe so i need to get them on Amazon. my dentist told me it's ok to use these as long as i get regularly check-ups (also says that on the box).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It really works compared to other products out their. I have had it for several months now and it's holding up great. Their customer service is even better the original didn't really stick to my teeth as they were supposed so they sent my a coupon to buy another one for free. They event sent further instructions in case the instructions included did not work. Recommend to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Salloom

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work AND no return!
customer_reviews.text: "Insult to injury" the product didn't work although I followed the instruction and when they didn't work I discovered there is NO RETURN.
customer_reviews.author: MrkS

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. This is supposed to stick to your teeth when set, not move around. It’s also a chewy material which can cause you to clench/grind your teeth even more resulting in even more jaw pain. Although expensive, custom night guards from dental offices are the best option. I made a mistake trying to save money by buying this but I can’t even use it. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: DakPing

customer_reviews.title: The only one I'll use
customer_reviews.text: I always hated using mouth guards before, so my dentist recommended this brand. It's the only one that forms easily and keeps it's shape well for around 6 months (maybe longer, I just have it on subscribe and save for that long). It also doesn't make my mouth water like crazy, which happens with the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: First, the mouth piece does not stay in place. I've used this over a period of a month and it has stayed in place once. Secondly, i tried to remold it as the directions stated and it was even looser afterwards. Third, I called to have it replaced 3 weeks ago and have yet to receive the replacement so that I could try again. This is simply a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: My dentist recommended I get a guard and my hygienist told me I should buy this one if I wanted a less expensive alternative that would probably work just fine. I had to try twice to get the proper fit but I got it and it doesn't bother my sleep. I highly recommend this product especially if the alternative is destroying your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Love this night guard!!! Recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the doctor's night guard. It's comfortable and easy to use. I love how the instructions are easy to follow. As long as you follow the steps, you'll have the perfect night guard. I've tried other night guards and all of them have felt like my front teeth were breaking but not this one. This is is simple to wear and its not too tight or you loose. If you are looking to wear a comfortable night guard, go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Venesa

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand for years, works great and doesn’t feel like too much in my mouth. Happy to have found a sale so I stocked up lol no more headaches with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Bulky
customer_reviews.text: Hard to stay asleep with this. While I don't have a problem with it slipping out of my mouth, I constantly wake up during the night because of the awkwardness of it being too bulky. I consulted a representative via telephone who said to try it two more times in boiled water to see if the fit would improve. It has only helped very little. They offer a money back guarantee so I will try to pursue that. I think part of the issue is they no longer have sizes, just one-size-fits-all. I think I will try to have a professional one made and bite the bullet on costs to have a more restful sleep.
customer_reviews.author: MHRez

customer_reviews.title: Does not mold
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why or how people think this is awesome. This product does not stick to my teeth whatsoever, not even close. It says I should be able to open my mouth and it doesn't fall off my teeth. Mine doesn't even have a chance of staying on my teeth. And this is after many remolding attempts in hotter and hotter boiling water. My plastic does NOT mold. Maybe I got a defective one...but I'm out $14 and have nothing now... This was my back up since the real one ($600) from my dentist was shattered by United Airlines and they refuse to pay for ANY of their negligence.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I tried this as it was cheaper than my normal mouth guard. I completely dislike it. It took 2 tries to mold, and then when I went to wear it was uncomfortable and just awful and hard. I couldn’t even wear it. Do not recommend... I’ll pay few more dollars for my normal mouth guard that is functional
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many other night guards. I grind my teeth a lot. This is the only product that I have used more than the initial trial. It is easily fitted to your mouth and after that, it stays put! I don't have to worry about it coming off during sleep. It lasts a long time too.
customer_reviews.author: MarieS

customer_reviews.title: Best Guard Ever
customer_reviews.text: There is no better night guard out there. I've tried skimping on the cost and have always lost. No matter the cost of this guard it is by far the best you can obtain outside of a dentist's office. I've had trouble grinding my teeth for the last few years and this protects my teeth the best. Lasts 6 months. Clean monthly with denture cleaning tablets. Read the directions and perform the molding carefully. You cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Too thick
customer_reviews.text: It is very big and very thick. There is no way to close your mouth with it in. I tried to reshape is as on the directions but this does not work. You need to get it right the first time. But either way, it’s really too thick and uncomfortable to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I rated this from my personal experience. It didn’t work well for me and my teeth, but that doesn’t mean it won’t work for others.
customer_reviews.author: Rayray

customer_reviews.title: May cause bite problems - too much pressure on front teeth
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t go all the way to the back of the molars. If it covered all the teeth, it would be great, but because it doesn’t go all the way back, it puts a lot of pressure on your front teeth and may cause orthodontic issues.
customer_reviews.author: Messy Mom

customer_reviews.title: It's kind of a pain to make the mold. ...
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of a pain to make the mold. You nuke it for a few minutes and then you're expected to stick this hot piece of rubber into your mouth. Luckily, if you screw up you can heat it again, reform the rubber, and try again. After I made the mold, it was uncomfortable so I had to use a Dremel tool to remove some of the pointy edges. In spite of all the hassles, the product works as intended and I wouldn't want to sleep without it.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Wright

customer_reviews.title: I used to love this product
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product! The mouth piece handled my grinding for 6mos, compared to competitors whose product only lasted 2-3mos. However, this product no longer includes the forming tray to create the perfect teeth/bite fit. I ruined the molding and tried several times, but it is crap!!! I wish the company would include the tray because I used to really like this mouth guard.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not for pple who wear braces
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the idea that this is only for the top of the mouth. If you have braces you can't use this. Wish I had known this before I bought it. Not to mention it would take stay in my daughter's mouth during the night. Kinda defeats the purpose of it won't stay put to do it's job!!
customer_reviews.author: JohariK

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered due to good reviews & my dentist said he had patients it worked for. It didn’t work for me. It wouldn’t soften enough to make it work. As promised, the company sent me a coupon for another to try it again for free, and gave me advice on how to Boil it differently. We both thought maybe it wasn’t hot enough. I believe I followed instructions to a “t” both times, and this time it was steaming hotter than last, but it didn’t come close to working. I’ll try a different product and if I can’t get it to work, will have to invest in a custom dentist mouth guard, which he said is $365!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Kimball

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Nightguard I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: The construction is sturdy. The base is made of hard but slightly malleable material, while the top is coated with form fitting clear material which softens when heated. After that, it snaps into place and doesn't shift or fall off while sleeping. This is an excellent product! Don't bother with the cheap store brands, like the one Rite-Aid sells (it fell apart in a few weeks). I have many porcelain crowns, so it's essential that I wear a good nightguard to prevent severe damage to my teeth at night. Doctor's Nightguard is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MrEguy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. Won’t mold around the teeth. Caused pain at night and discomfort. And yes i did it correctly and followed instructions. Cheap and would not waste your money. I tossed mine out.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a lot of mouthguards and they really don’t work, this one on the other hand actually Holds perfectly to your teeth and they last about three months four months if you take good care of them.
customer_reviews.author: 60's Flower child

customer_reviews.title: The only guard I use for teeth grinding... but you have to get the fit right
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten many of these to prevent my grinding problem because I didn't trust the $600 dentist one. I've been really happy with the product... IF you get the fit right. I have a 50% success rating and retrying isn't the same. But when you do get it right, you won't sleep the same without it. If you get it wrong, your significant other will complain about your slurping sounds. Still, I like the mix of soft fit with a tougher bottom and switching out every 6 months as they recommend is working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: K12

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The bottom part of the mouth gaurd is too large and sticks out. I sleep with my mouth slightly open, which is a bit uncomfortable, and when I wake in the morning I find the mouth gaurd out of my mouth and somewhere on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The process for fitting this into your mouth is a joke. I tried twice then threw it away. I won't buy this again. Did not have such a hard time with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: While one portion of it worked, I couldn’t get the top portion to stick. I tried the directions on the box as well as those found in the reviews and online, I just couldn’t make it work unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: The mold was a little hard to form around front of teeth but at least you can keep replacing in hot water to tey and fix till you get it right, in my case i never fully got it to go high on front of teeth but it works
customer_reviews.author: Dustin alsup

customer_reviews.title: Good for teeth grinding
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 3 times and love it. Really reduce tooth wear. Easy to get it ready and comfortable to wear it at night. & my dentist also recommends this production for me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lee

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure how I slept through the night without it
customer_reviews.text: I really love this thing, I used boiling water to do the melting process because I don't have a microwave. I found it easy to shape and have been surprised at how well it is holding up. I definitely recommend soaking it in Listerine, otherwise, I find it has a bad taste from brushing alone.
customer_reviews.author: I and E

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is cheaper than teeth.
customer_reviews.text: I started using these because my dentist said I was showing signs of grinding my teeth. As he put it, I had the option of wearing down my teeth or getting a bite guard to absorb the damage. Figuring plastic was easier to replace than enamel, I chose to get a bite guard. I've been using this brand for years, if you fit it right, there aren't any problems with it staying in place all night. And, if you don't get it right the first time, you can heat it up and try again.
customer_reviews.author: Kengineer

customer_reviews.title: Tough to fit an get right the first time
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit right on the first fitting and the subsequent try resulted in a worse fit. The manufacturer will send one new replacement which is great, but I didn't and threw it away. So it was a complete waste of money. Just beware it is finicky to sometimes get a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Best mouth guard I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: I opted not to pay hundreds of dollars for a mouth guard from the dentist and found this product instead. I'm super impressed. It's very easy to mold and once you do, it lasts for a pretty decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kurstie Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Grind no more
customer_reviews.text: I am Fire Fighter, Married, Mom of 4... I have a lot on my plate so you can understand that stress is in my life. Lately, I have been clinching my teeth while I sleep. Leaving me tired with a very sore mouth the entire day. I went to the dentist and had a night guard fitted for me. I HATED it! It was very hard and made things even worse. I really like this night guard because it has some give. The fitting is not 100% perfect but it is a huge improvement from not having anything.
customer_reviews.author: Bree REAL

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Happiness at last! I clench my teeth at night when I'm stressed. My old mouthguard was big and bulky. I felt like boxer after 10 rounds. This one is sleek and slim. Easy to fit your mouth. You mold it to your teeth with your fingers while it's warm so it fits perfectly. It only wraps around your top teeth but not your front ones. It's barely noticeable but really does the job. Plus it's half price compared to my local pharmacy. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mraff

customer_reviews.title: Best month guard
customer_reviews.text: I've had to wear night guards for 25 years because of my night grinding. I will destroy a lot of the cheap kinds you can pick up at the pharmacy within a week or two. These are the best made comfortable and durable mouth guards I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: I have a weird shape jaw so this took a few times to get to fit right. Dentist recommend
customer_reviews.author: Crystal n.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awful! Followed instructions to a “T”. Wouldn’t mold to my teeth-simply stayed a block of plastic even after the boiling water. I’m using my teeth bleaching tray instead. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Clark

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Mold Properly / Super Bulky
customer_reviews.text: This item was incredibly bulky and would not mold. No matter how hard I closed my mouth or how long I left it in the water to heat up, it would not mold properly and i could barely close my mouth with it in. Very unhappy especially since many of the reviews were so positive. My husband also wears a night guard and his is much slimmer and molded on the first try.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Landis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Paid three times the money in the box store very good value This is the same thing for less money
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J Warren jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I had such bad anxiety that it was causing me to bite a hole in my cheek in my sleep. Obviously, I had to do something about it. I’m a college student and not willing to spend $$$$. But this was worth it! Easy to melt, mold, and use. I even used it on top of my retainers! It was perfect! 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money at the dentist
customer_reviews.text: I am a major jaw clencher and grinder, and needed a replacement for my $500 mouthguard after my dogs ate it. This nightguard is NOT the answer. It is difficult to fit, and a non-professional fit affects your jaw position causing pain and additional grinding. It is better to go without a guard than to use this one. It also caused a weird itching and swelling in my gums and lips, so it may not be a good idea for those with latex allergies (although I don't know if it has latex in it?).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Helps with teeth grinding. Been wearing daily for years. This is the best quality one I found.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyne D.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable solution
customer_reviews.text: I wear a nightguard most nights for teeth grinding. I had paid for a dentist-made $500 out-of-pocket one a few years ago (insurance doesn't cover these usually), but it snapped in half when I was cleaning it....seriously. I was so mad. So now I'm back to using these temporary guards. If you haven't used one in 3-4 years, try it again: they're slimmer and don't feel like a football teeth guard anymore. They last me about a year, and at this price it'll take many many years before I reach $500. And they don't snap in half.
customer_reviews.author: C.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Teeth Grinding
customer_reviews.text: I use this every night to relieve jaw pain from teeth grinding. Easy to personalize it to your own mouth. Sturdy and easy to transport with case when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Probably A waste of money for many
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on the positive reviews. Following the instructions carefully (boiling water for 50 seconds, cooling for 20 seconds, molding for 20 seconds, additonal molding, etc.), I found this product extremely difficult to mold into a comfortable fit. I made three attempts at molding it to fit my teeth but still could not get quite what I would call a fit that anyone could reasonably get used to . Others seem to like this product, so maybe it's just me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: Did not work returned it. Mouth piece does not align well. This is something a dentist should administer.
customer_reviews.author: Ciera Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Take your $13.60 and just flush it down the toilet first - and don't bother ordering it. Scam too - buyer does not allow for returns. Pathetic customer service!!!!!! 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: DMD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, cheap night guard
customer_reviews.text: I’ve spent hundreds of dollars on night guards from my dentist and none come close to the comfort of this one. Highly recommend this night guard, well worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: M. Z. R.

product_meta.title: The Doctor's NightGuard, Dental Guard for Teeth Grinding
product_meta.description: Style Name:Night GuardProtecting your teeth from the damaging effects of teeth grinding is easy with the Doctor's night guard, a dental protector for nighttime teeth grinding. The Doctor's night guard was designed by a team of dentists who saw the damage that teeth grinding could do. Over 1,200 prototypes were developed to ultimately select the top-performing advanced comfort design. This premium comfort design is patented and only available from the Doctor's.
feature_bullets: Developed by team of dentists, The Doctor’s NightGuard is a moldable, custom fit dental guard that helps prevent damage from nighttime teeth grinding
BPA-Free Dental Guard with a patented two-layer design that includes a soft top layer to cushion and absorb and a firm bottom layer to prevent teeth grinding
Slim and Flexible Design that helps you sleep comfortably.  Patented slanted front provides more comfort by keeping material away from lips and gums

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
